channel.description: Recent content in Computer Science on metafunctor

item.title: digistar: Advanced Sandbox Networked Space Simulation
item.description: An advanced sandbox space simulation game leveraging GPU acceleration and optimized data structures like octrees to create a highly interactive and scalable sandbox for large n-body systems.

item.title: Homomorphic computational extensions
item.description: Class of homomorphic monads that extend algebraic data types in some well-defined way for faciliating faster or more accurate calculations, such as the logarithm trick.

item.title: Multiprocessor synchronization: tournament-Peterson lock
item.description:
Multiprocessor synchronization is a notoriously tricky subject matter. Unlike with a single thread of execution, in a shared-resource system, where resources are shared among multiple independent processors, we must think very hard about how the critical sections where such shared resources are accessed.

Definition: Peterson’s algorithm is a concurrent programming algorithm for mutual exclusion that allows two or more processes to share a single-use resource without conflict, using only shared memory for communication.
